title.justification: The title "Biological Psychiatry Poster Abstracts" is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.

extractions.description: This paper reviews abstracts regarding mental health effects of environmental factors, neural mechanisms related to psychiatric disorders, and genetic influences on neural disorders. It includes systematic reviews and empirical studies involving animal and human subjects.

type.justification: The paper includes systematic reviews and empirical studies examining the relationship between air pollution and mental health, as well as genetic studies on schizophrenia.
type.quote: We systematically reviewed the MEDLINE database in Sept. 2021, for original articles reporting effects of air pollution on 1) anxiety or depressive symptoms and 2) frontolimbic brain regions.

name.justification: The primary focus is on psychiatric conditions and their links to environmental exposure and genetic conditions.
name.quote: development of anhedonia and could further development of treatment strategies for those at risk for psychopathology.

name.justification: The paper discusses neural mechanisms and brain region changes related to psychiatric disorders.
name.quote: neuroscientific research suggests the link between air pollution and poor mental health may relate to neurostructural/neurofunctional changes.

name.justification: There is also a focus on genetic influences, specifically related to schizophrenia risk.
name.quote: Heterozygous null mutations of SETD1A are definitively linked to increased schizophrenia risk in humans.
